t: For the choir director: according to Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
I*pn am at rest in God alone; my*ln salvation comes from him.
He*ln alone is my rock and my salvation, my*ln stronghold; I will never be shaken.
How*pn long will you threaten a man? Will*ln all of you attack as*ln if he were a leaning wall or*ln a tottering fence?
They*ln only plan to bring him down from*ln his high position. They*ln take pleasure in lying; they*ln bless with their mouths, but*ln they curse inwardly. Selah*ig
Rest*pn in God alone, my soul, for*ln my hope comes from him.
He*ln alone is my rock and my salvation, my*ln stronghold; I will not be shaken.
My*ln salvation and glory depend on God, my strong rock. My*ln refuge is in God.
Trust*ln in him at all times, you people; pour*ln out your hearts before him. God*ln is our refuge. Selah*ig
Common*pn people are only a vapor; important*ln people, an illusion. Together*ln on a scale, they*ln weigh less than a vapor.
Place*ln no trust in oppression or*ln false hope in robbery. If*ln wealth increases, donâ€™t*ln set your heart on it.
God*pn has spoken once; I*ln have heard this twice: strength*ln belongs to God,
and*ln faithful love belongs to you, Lord. For*ln you repay each according to his works.
